intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical dotweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading herb with slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals and prominent stamens, making it visually distinctive. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
